Antonio Álvarez-López

PhD student

Bio

I am a PhD student at Universidad Autónoma de Madrid (affiliated with Instituto de Ciencias Matemáticas) and Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg. My research focuses on the mathematical foundations of machine learning, specifically on the analysis and control of continuous-time neural network architectures such as neural ODEs and flow-based generative models.

Currently, I am visiting my PhD advisor Prof. Enrique Zuazua at Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg, following a very fruitful research stay at the National University of Singapore (August – November 2025), where I worked with Prof. Qianxiao Li on advanced topics in machine learning theory.

Updates

  • February 2026 I spent a free moment while working on my thesis to iterate a bit more on my website's design.
  • February 2025 To give myself a hand with my thesis, I built a couple of tools: one for merging different BibTeX files (see here) and a visualizer for MLPs and ResNets (see here).
  • January 2025 New preprint on arXiv! In collaboration with Borjan Geshkovski and Domènec Ruiz-Balet, we uploaded our work "Perceptrons and localization of attention's mean-field landscape". We study the forward pass of Transformers as interacting particle systems on the sphere, analyzing how the perceptron block affects the mean-field limit.
  • December 2025 I attended the IMS International Conference on Statistics and Data Science (ICSDS) in Seville. I had the honor of receiving the Student Travel Award from Richard Samworth in person. I also presented my talk "Continuous-Time Learning of Probability Distributions via Neural ODEs...". It was a fantastic experience!
  • November 2025 I completed my research stay at the National University of Singapore. It was an incredibly productive period where I learned a lot and met brilliant researchers. I am now back at FAU Erlangen-Nürnberg visiting my PhD advisor.
  • October 2025 New preprint on arXiv! In collaboration with fellow PhD student Martin Hernández, we uploaded our work "Convergence, design and training of continuous-time dropout as a random batch method".
  • October 2025 I decided to create this personal website to share my research and academic activities.
  • September 2025 I received the Student Travel Award at the IMS International Conference on Statistics and Data Science (ICSDS) 2025.
  • September 2025 I gave two seminars on "Entropy-driven control of the continuity equation for normalizing flows":
    • Sep 29: Machine Learning and Scientific Computing Seminar, NUS.
    • Sep 16: Nonlinear PDE Seminar, Texas A&M University.
  • August 2025 I started a 3-month research visit at the National University of Singapore, working with Prof. Qianxiao Li's group.
